reviewText: I like all these movies... However, the packaging for this collection is not what I was expecting. The car fresheners included in this collection are nice looking, but they have a strong unpleasant smell. I had to throw them away. The smell was so bad that you could smell it through the shipping package. The burger car freshener smelled the worst.I wish this collection included the 3D edition of the last movie... But I'm overall pleased with this collection. I recommend to fans.

reviewText: Everything about this set is awesome. You get a bunch of extra bonus items which include a coaster set for your beverages and a set of 3 Car Freshners. I would give it a 5 star but the collectors case was a great novel idea however it was cheaply made and dings and dents fairly easily. Other than that it's a great collection. Wish they would make another Harold and Kumar soon.
summary: Great Set I love the EXTRAS!!!!

reviewText: The Harold & Kumar films are very funny and will have you laughing practically non-stop. You get 3 films on 3 discs in this collection: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle, Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay, and A Very Harold & Kumar Christmas. 'White Castle' and 'Guantanamo Bay' offer the unrated versions, while 'Christmas' includes both the R-rated and unrated cuts (but not the 3D version of Christmas which is sold separately). Overall, the picture quality is very good and audio quality is great. The three films come packaged inside a collectible tin box with a White Castle scented air freshener and White Castle scented coasters. The whole thing comes in a larger package designed to mimic a lighter. There is over 2.5 hours of total bonus content plus 5 audio commentaries (although Christmas doesn't have an audio commentary). The sequels are lacking in bonus content and the first two films could use a good remastering. This set works as a value pack because the price is right but it is not a deluxe edition of the films. These are 4 star films in a 3 star package since it is simply a repackaging of three existing Blu-ray discs. UltraViolet digital copies are *not* provided for the films (although the stand-alone versions come with them).Video Resolution/Codec: 1080p AVC/MPEG-4; 1080p VC-1 | Aspect Ratio: 1.85:1; 2.40:1Audio Formats: English DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1, English DTS-HD Master Audio 7.1, Spanish Dolby Digital 5.1, Portuguese Dolby Digital 5.1, French Dolby Digital 5.1Subtitles/Captions: English SDH, French, Spanish, PortugueseSpecial Features:"Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle" [91 minutes]* Audio commentary with director Danny Leiner and actors John Cho and Kal Penn* Audio commentary with writers Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg* "Extreme" commentary with Danny Bouchard* John Cho and Kal Penn: The Back Seat Interview* The Art of the Fart* Cast and Crew: Drive-Thru Bites* A Trip to the Land of Burgers* Deleted/alternate scenes* John Cho and Kal Penn's induction into the "White Castle Craver's Hall of Fame"* Harold and Kumar 2 Red Band trailer* Harold and Kumar sneak peek* "Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle" trailer and Red Band trailer"Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay" [48 minutes]* "Dude Change the Movie" interactive features that puts you in control of Harold and Kumar's trip - select from new and alternate scenes to change the course of the film* Commentary with the directors and stars* Commentary with Hurwitz and Schlossberg* "The World of Harold and Kumar" featurette* 27 additional scenes and much more!  "A Very Harold & Kumar Christmas Special" [18 minutes]* Theatrical version and the extended cut* "Through the Haze" with Tom Lennon* "Bringing Harold & Kumar Claymation to Life"

reviewText: Hysterical to say the least. The 2 stoners are back for more adventure. I met Kal Penn a long time ago but he was so cool it's not even funny. So I guess you could say I have a connection with the Harold and Kumar series. I enjoyed every minute of it.Plus the hot girls in it didn't hurt LOL
